page.title: 08Fields,woods,paths:Cheshire.
page.content: Except near Saighton where sometimes there are walls of local sandstone,the fields usually have a hedge & a ditch. All the hedges are trimmed by machine in autumn.Hedges are of hawthorn with some holly & elder & at intervals mature trees,mainly oak,which are sometimes evenly spaced,indicating deliberate planting many years ago eg.in Millfield Lane & along Platts Lane.Nearly every field also has its own mature tree(s) providing shade for animals.A much larger deciduous wood follows the Waverton Approach & some smaller areas act as windbreaks around houses eg.Hattonheath farm & Hatton Lodge,but there are only a few other small areas eg. Saighton Gorse.Because of the boundary changes to make arable fields,the Grosvenor Estate is seeking permission to change the routes of some little-used paths crossing them.
